txt.en:
'We have made it this far undetected. The path ahead to Barad-dûr will be difficult.

'What's this?! Look ahead [placeholder]. There seems to be some sort of meeting taking place on the road between us and the ruined tower.

'You have dealt with some of these foes before. Still, a meeting of Dulgabêth's minions does not bode well for us.

'We must attempt to get closer and listen in on their plans, whatever they may be. From there we should have enough information to devise a proper plan.'
Get closer so that you may overhear the conversation.
Get closer so that you may overhear the conversation
Confront Dulgabêth's servants and retrieve the Ithil-stone.
'I am not sure what it is we are seeing over there atop that rock. Its glow is soft, almost Elven. Do you suppose it is some sort of weapon perhaps?'
'We should return swiftly and tell the Elves of our company about what we have seen here. They may want to investigate this further.'
Confront Dulgabêth's servants and retrieve the Ithil-stone
This is a good place to listen
'We should return swiftly and tell the other Elves of our company about what we have seen here. They may want to investigate this further.'
'You seem struck in awe at what we have seen. Perhaps we should return swiftly and tell the other Elves of our company about this. They may want to investigate this further.'
You see something glinting from atop a rock spire

'Argh! This certainly did not go as planned, [placeholder]. This is not the fault of either of us. Not a one of us expected these Morroval to descend and snatch the Ithil-stone from us all!

'Now we must return empty handed. Our only solace is that we have defeated The Black Word's lieutenants once again.

'Come let us start on the return.'
Ingold is concerned that in defeat, Dulgabêth and his followers may direct their wrath upon Gondorians in Mordor.
